metadata.Title: CVE-2015-4852 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description: The WLS Security component in Oracle WebLogic Server 10.3.6.0, 12.1.2.0,12.1.3.0, and 12.2.1.0 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrarycommands via a crafted serialized Java object in T3 protocol traffic to TCPport 7001, related tooracle_common/modules/com.bea.core.apache.commons.collections.jar. NOTE:the scope of this CVE is limited to the WebLogic Server product.

criterions.comment: libcommons-collections3-java: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
libcommons-collections4-java: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
openjdk-6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
openjdk-7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
